com.pgmacdesign.pgmactips.adaptersandlisteners

Interface CustomLongClickCallbackLink

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MultipurposeChoiceDialog

    public interface CustomLongClickCallbackLink
    This class serves as an interface link between long click events and an activity/ fragment. Created by pmacdowell on 8/16/2016.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void itemLongClicked(java.lang.Object object, java.lang.Integer customTag, java.lang.Integer positionIfAvailable)
      For sending data between the event where this is long clicked and the activity / fragment

    • Method Detail

      • itemLongClicked

        void itemLongClicked(@Nullable
                     java.lang.Object object,
                     @Nullable
                     java.lang.Integer customTag,
                     @Nullable
                     java.lang.Integer positionIfAvailable)
        For sending data between the event where this is long clicked and the activity / fragment
        Parameters:
        object - Object(s) being sent back. if you want, you can use if(obj instanceof XX) and use that as a separator.
        customTag - The integer custom tag. Use this for sending back specific tags that you want to reference and differentiate between.
        positionIfAvailable - int position. This will be sent back as not null when there is a reason to include it. That reason may be that the item selected was chosen from a listview/ Recyclerview, in which case the position can be helpful. If this is not set, it will send back null instead.
